page.title: 16EDUCATION IN KEISS
page.content: There has been a school in Keiss for more than 220 years. The school today has 3 teachers with 63 pupils coming from Keiss, Auckengill and Lyth. We have visiting teachers of music, art, P.E, and needlework for part of each year, and a remedial teacher comes each week. Two thirds of the children stay for lunch which is cooked in the school.A two course meal costs 55p. The school opens at 9.50,and shuts at 4.00pm, in order to fit in with buses. Lunchtime lasts 55 minutes. Favourite games in the playground include Army (a war game), football (which is played by the older boys and girls), tig, and skipping (played by the girls). This year the school had to close early 6 times because the snow was making the roads slippery & difficult. The school year is 40 weeks long.
